column2: As the company s Physical Design leader, you will be responsible for leading all aspects of digital SoC implementation, from floorplanning through to signoff.       You will be required to develop world class physical design methodologies and flow automation, for chip floorplan, power/clock distribution, chip assembly, P&R and timing closure.     You will lead, scale, and develop an international physical design team.     You will work with integration, mixed signal and digital design engineers to understand all target requirements required to complete the physical implementation.     You will contribute to a positive, trusting, and cohesive working environment based on integrity and strong work ethics.           Key Qualifications         BS and/or MS in Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, or related field     Minimum 15+ years in physical design, timing closure, and physical verification signoff experience     Proven technical and people leadership track record in successfully leading/managing complex FinFet SoCs to tapeout     Demonstrated experience of building, growing, and retaining successful local and international teams     Hands-on hierarchical physical design experience at block and full chip levels     Power user in physical design, STA, and physical verification industry-standard EDA tools     Strong analytical and debugging skills     Experience defining deliveries and specifying delivery from other teams     Proficiency using Tcl, and Make scripting     Self-motivated and able to lead and drive team and project         Additional Success Factors     Experience in any of the following areas:       7nm/5nm/3nm technologies     Experience in Power, Performance and Area improvement.         Physical design of mixed signal interfaces.     Experience integrating IP such as Serdes from major IP vendors     Perl or Python scripting         Personal Skills         Excellent communication/documentation skills.     Attention to details.     Collaboration across multidisciplinary and international teams.         What you ll get in return:         Technology depth and breadth expansion that can t be found in a large company     Opportunity to grow your career as the company grows     Pre IPO stock options     Cutting edge technology     World class team     Competitive base salary     Flexible hours     Medical, dental and vision insurance for employees     Flexible vacation time to promote a healthy work-life balance     Paid parental leave to support you and your family

To be able to understand the clients customer life cycle, touchpoints where customer data is captured and business processes to collect, analyse and consume this data for various purposes such as marketing, sales, customer service etc. Good understanding of Data Stewardship and Governance process - Manual Merge, Hierarchy Management, Workflow Management, Unmerge, Curation, Survivorship, etc. Define requirements for data quality rules, data matching and merging rules, survivorship criteria, and data stewardship workflows. Good hands-on experience on Java & Python technologies Significant experience in designing and implementing MDM solutions, data models, and data hierarchies. column2: Required Skills  Technology | Meraki WLAN Expert - Level 3 Support  Technology | Cisco R and S Network Design SME - Level 4 Support  Technology | Cisco WLAN Design SME - Level 4 Support     Education Qualification :   Engineer - B.E / B.Tech / MCA     Certification Mandatory / Desirable :  Technology | Expert Level Certification - ACMX / CCIE Wireless    Delivery Skills:  1. Technology Management: Responsible for overall network technology management for the business. Responsible for planning and execution of new technology roll outs, scope expansion and readiness of team from technology standpoint. Manage SOPs, Knowledge documents, KB articles. Implement technical methodology improvement from past failures and learnings.  2. Restoration and Resolution: Identify the network issue based on troubleshooting and decide on the actions required to be implemented for resolving the issue. Refer to required KEDB or Knowledge bases for known issues/repetitive issues and resolution steps. Implement the resolution steps, execute, validate and update ticket with steps taken and outcome.  3. Triage: Once the resolution steps are completed if the issue is still not resolved or if it s an unknown issue and standard troubleshooting methods did not resolve the issue, escalate the ticket to L3 Network SME and support the troubleshooting process, if there is a bridge, continue on the bridge along with the SME. This support includes coordination with 3rd party network vendor technicians.  4. Process Compliance:  - Gather information from vendor, customer, analysis from the troubleshooting/investigation, resolution steps implemented etc. and update the tickets regularly as per the defined process  - Prepare a detailed report on the plan of action for the existing tickets for the next shift engineer (Shift Handover Report)  - Followthrough andexecute the various Escalation Matrix (Vendor, Internal and Customer defined)  - Maintain inventory of Network equipments and links  - Constantly track tickets for SLA adherence and escalate on deviations as defined in the process  5. Value Proposition: Understand the existing environment and propose any opportunity of improvement. Look at nagging issues in the environment and come out with Get Around solutions by working with vendors and industry experts.

column2: Are you a skilled IT professional with a passion for designing and implementing Redhat Openshift solutions? If so, we want to hear from you! Torry Harris, a leading digital transformation company, is currently seeking talented individuals to join our team as Redhat Openshift Designers.    Job Description:    As a Redhat Openshift Designer at Torry Harris, you will be responsible for designing and implementing Openshift solutions that meet the needs of our clients. You will work closely with our clients to understand their requirements and provide expert guidance on how to best leverage Redhat Openshift to meet their business objectives.    Key Responsibilities:    1. Collaborate with clients to understand their business needs and technical requirements  2. Design and architect Redhat Openshift solutions that align with client objectives and industry best practices  3. Develop detailed technical specifications and documentation for Openshift solutions  4. Work with development and operations teams to implement and support Openshift solutions  5. Provide expert guidance and support to clients and internal teams on Openshift best practices and troubleshooting  6. Stay current with industry trends and emerging technologies related to Redhat Openshift    Qualifications:    - Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field  - Redhat Openshift certification is preferred  - Minimum of 3 years of experience designing and implementing Redhat Openshift solutions  - Strong understanding of containerization and orchestration technologies  - Expertise in Linux and cloud computing platforms (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud)  - Excellent communication and interpersonal skills  - Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced, dynamic environment    Why Join Torry Harris?    At Torry Harris, we believe in fostering a collaborative and innovative work environment. We offer competitive salaries, comprehensive benefits, and opportunities for professional growth and development. As a Redhat Openshift Designer, you will have the chance to work on exciting projects with leading companies across various industries.    If you are passionate about Redhat Openshift and want to be a part of a dynamic team, we encourage you to apply for the role of Redhat Openshift Designer at Torry Harris. Join us in shaping the future of digital transformation!    Roles and Responsibilities   Red Hat OpenShift is a cloud computing platform that enables enterprises to effortlessly build, deploy, and manage containerized applications. Red Hat OpenShift designers play a crucial role in the successful implementation and operation of this platform. In this blog, we will discuss the roles and responsibilities of Red Hat OpenShift designers, including the skills required to excel in this role.    Roles and Responsibilities of Red Hat OpenShift Designers:    1. Creating and designing application architectures: Red Hat OpenShift designers are responsible for creating and designing application architectures using the platform's various tools and features. They must have a deep understanding of containerization and microservices architectures to develop scalable and resilient applications.    2. Implementing and managing infrastructure: Red Hat OpenShift designers are tasked with implementing and managing the infrastructure necessary to run applications on the platform. This includes provisioning and configuring compute resources, networking, and storage to support the application workloads.    3. Managing security and compliance: Red Hat OpenShift designers play a crucial role in ensuring the security and compliance of the applications running on the platform. This includes implementing security best practices, configuring access controls, and monitoring for any vulnerabilities or non-compliance.    4. Collaborating with development teams: OpenShift designers work closely with development teams to understand their application requirements and help them optimize their applications for the platform. They provide guidance on best practices for developing and deploying applications on OpenShift.    5. Providing technical support: Red Hat OpenShift designers are responsible for providing technical support to application developers, operations teams, and other stakeholders. They troubleshoot issues, optimize performance, and assist with debugging and performance tuning.    Skills Required for Red Hat OpenShift Designers:    1. Proficiency in containerization technologies: Red Hat OpenShift designers must have a deep understanding of containerization technologies such as Docker and Kubernetes.    2. Experience with cloud infrastructure: Knowledge of cloud infrastructure and experience working with platforms such as AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud Platform is essential for OpenShift designers.    3. Understanding of DevOps practices: Red Hat OpenShift designers should be familiar with DevOps principles and practices, including continuous integration/continuous deployment (CI/CD) pipelines and infrastructure automation.    4. Strong communication and collaboration skills: OpenShift designers need to effectively communicate with development teams, operations teams, and other stakeholders, making strong communication and collaboration skills essential.    In conclusion, Red Hat OpenShift designers play a crucial role in the successful implementation and management of the platform. Their responsibilities include designing application architectures, managing infrastructure, ensuring security and compliance, collaborating with development teams, and providing technical support. To excel in this role, OpenShift designers need to have proficiency in containerization technologies, experience with cloud infrastructure, understanding of DevOps practices, and strong communication and collaboration skills.

column2: Are you an experienced Confluent Kafka Developer looking for a new opportunity? Look no further than Torry Harris! We are currently seeking a talented and experienced individual to join our team as a Senior Confluent Kafka Developer.    The Senior Confluent Kafka Developer will be responsible for designing, developing, and implementing high-performance, scalable, and reliable Kafka solutions for our clients. This individual will work closely with our clients to understand their business needs and requirements, and will be responsible for designing and implementing Kafka solutions that meet those needs.    Key responsibilities for this role include:    - Designing and developing Kafka clusters, brokers, topics, partitions, and consumer groups  - Implementing and maintaining Kafka connectors for various data sources and sinks  - Optimizing Kafka performance and scalability  - Troubleshooting and resolving Kafka-related issues  - Working with cross-functional teams to integrate Kafka solutions with other systems and applications  - Providing technical guidance and support to junior members of the team    The ideal candidate for this role will have a strong background in Kafka development and architecture, as well as experience working with Confluent Platform. In addition, the candidate should have experience working with large-scale, distributed systems and be familiar with best practices for designing and implementing Kafka solutions.    Other qualifications for this role include:    - 5+ years of experience working with Kafka and related technologies  - Strong programming skills, with experience in Java, Scala, or Python  - Experience with streaming data platforms and technologies, such as Apache Flink, Apache Spark, or Apache NiFi  - Experience with cloud platforms, such as AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud  - Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to work effectively with clients and cross-functional teams    At Torry Harris, we are committed to providing our employees with a challenging and rewarding work environment, as well as opportunities for professional growth and development. If you are a talented and experienced Confluent Kafka Developer looking for a new opportunity, we encourage you to apply for the role of Senior Confluent Kafka Developer with our company.    If you are interested in joining our team, please submit your resume and cover letter to [email protected] We look forward to hearing from you!    Roles and Responsibilities   The role of a Senior Confluent Kafka Developer is an important one, as it involves the design, development, and maintenance of Kafka-based solutions for managing and processing real-time data streams. This requires a deep understanding of Apache Kafka and other related technologies, as well as strong programming and problem-solving skills. In this blog, we will discuss the roles and responsibilities that come with being a Senior Confluent Kafka Developer.    Roles and responsibilities:     Lead the design, development, and deployment of scalable and reliable Kafka-based solutions using Confluent Platform.   Provide technical guidance and mentorship to junior developers on Kafka best practices, architecture, and implementation.   Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather requirements and define technical architecture for data streaming applications.   Architect and configure Kafka clusters for performance, reliability, and scalability.   Develop custom Kafka Connect connectors and Kafka Streams applications to meet business requirements.   Lead efforts to monitor Kafka cluster health and performance and implement proactive measures to maintain system stability.   Troubleshoot and resolve complex issues related to Kafka infrastructure, data pipelines, and streaming applications.   Stay abreast of emerging Kafka technologies and industry trends, and drive innovation in our data streaming capabilities.   Designing and developing Kafka-based solutions: A Senior Confluent Kafka Developer is responsible for designing and developing scalable, high-performance Kafka-based solutions for managing and processing real-time data streams. This may involve architecting the infrastructure, developing custom Kafka connectors, and optimizing performance.   Leading development teams: Senior Confluent Kafka Developers are often responsible for leading development teams and guiding junior developers in the implementation of Kafka solutions. This involves providing technical guidance, reviewing code, and ensuring adherence to best practices.   Performance optimization: It is the responsibility of a Senior Confluent Kafka Developer to optimize the performance of Kafka clusters and ensure that they can handle high-throughput data streams without any lag. This may involve tuning Kafka configurations, optimizing networking and server resources, and troubleshooting performance issues.   Monitoring and maintenance: Senior Confluent Kafka Developers are responsible for monitoring the health and performance of Kafka clusters and addressing any issues that arise. This includes setting up monitoring systems, performing routine maintenance tasks, and implementing disaster recovery solutions.   ?Integration with other systems: Kafka is often used as a central data pipeline in complex distributed systems. Senior Confluent Kafka Developers are responsible for integrating Kafka with other systems, such as databases, messaging queues, and data processing frameworks, to ensure seamless data flow.   Collaboration with other teams: Senior Confluent Kafka Developers work closely with other teams, such as data engineering, data science, and infrastructure teams, to understand their requirements and integrate Kafka solutions with their systems. This may involve participating in design discussions, providing technical expertise, and coordinating implementation efforts.   Documentation and training: It is important for Senior Confluent Kafka Developers to document their designs, implementations, and best practices to facilitate knowledge sharing and training for other team members. This includes creating technical documentation, conducting training sessions, and mentoring junior developers.      In conclusion, a Confluent Kafka Designer plays a crucial role in the design and implementation of Kafka-based solutions for managing real-time data streams. This role requires a deep understanding of Kafka and related technologies, as well as strong leadership and communication skills to effectively collaborate with other teams. By fulfilling these roles and responsibilities, a Confluent Kafka Designer contributes to the successful operation of real-time data processing systems.

column2: This position is for an expert in machine learning to help us extract value from our data. You will lead all the processes from data collection, cleaning, and preprocessing, to training models and deploying them to production. The key responsibilities will be to prepare modern Natural Language Technology (NLT) platforms to gain insights from key business data.      The employee will be responsible for designing, implementing and managing data preparation and advanced analytics tools in addition to demonstrating insights from the varied sources of data to business users. Responsibilities also include developing and designing language understanding/generation systems and effectively using text representation techniques.               Objectives of the role:               Work in tandem with our engineering partners to identify and implement the most optimal cloud-based ML solutions for the company.         Research, design and adopt cutting-edge NLG algorithms to address real-world challenges such as summarization.         Define and document best practices and strategies regarding deployment and infrastructure maintenance.         Ensure ML Model performance, uptime, and scale, maintaining high standards of code quality and thoughtful design.         Maintain a platform that automates creating, training, deploying and updating machine learning models.         Managing BI Platforms in accordance with company security guidelines         Build effective relationships with business areas, strategic vendors, and key delivery partners such as the Advanced Analytics and Data Sciences (AADS) group to share expertise and seek opportunities to reuse internal processes and services, so we can streamline implementation and support of key systems.               Required /Proven experience with the following:           Designing, developing, and researching Machine Learning systems, models, and schemes through data science and data analytics prototypes.         Understanding of Natural Language Processing (NLP), Natural Language Understanding (NLU) and Natural Language Generation (NLG)         Develop and implement technical efforts to design, build, and deploy AWS ML models at the direction of lead architects, including large-scale data processing, computationally intensive statistical modeling, and advanced analytics.         Familiarity with deep learning, machine learning and NLP/NLG frameworks (like Keras, TensorFlow or PyTorch etc.), HuggingFace Transformers and libraries (like scikit-learn, spacy, gensim, CoreNLP etc.)         Should have experience in AWS services such as SageMaker, Elasticsearch, and general knowledge of AWS architecture other services          Ability to write robust code in Python, Java and R         Experience optimizing model hyperparameter tuning for speed and cost         Experience in building MLOps pipeline using MLOps frameworks like Kubeflow, MLFlow, and DataRobot         Experience with Docker and Kubernetes         Familiarity with Eventbridge and AWS step function for workload orchestration         Experience with Agile Development.         Good experience in process improvement/change management methods          Knowledge of various aspects of an enterprise technology architecture like business, information, data, network, and security         Understanding and knowledge of system development life cycle methodologies (such as waterfall, agile software development, rapid prototyping, and DevOps)         Understanding and knowledge of IT service management (ITSM) and Information Technology Infrastructure Library (ITIL)         Excellent analytical, planning, organizational and technical and skills         Skilled at influencing, guiding, and facilitating stakeholders and peers with decision making         Ability to articulate new ideas and concepts to technical and nontechnical audiences         Ability to understand the long-term ("big picture") and short-term perspectives of situations                   Desirable Skills:               8-16 years of production model deployment experience for ML solutions         Highly motivated/self-starter with a sense of ownership, willingness to learn, and desire to succeed.         Strong teamwork, problem-solving, and analytical skills         Deep knowledge of math, probability, statistics and algorithms         Strong understanding of Pharma Quality Standards and Practices          Excellent leadership and interpersonal skills (both verbal and written)

column2: TechnoPurple IT Solutions Private Limited is looking for Database / SQL Programmer / Architect to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey      A SQL Developer, also known as a Database Developer, is responsible for designing, implementing, and managing database systems and writing SQL queries to retrieve and manipulate data      The job description (JD) of a SQL Developer typically includes the following responsibilities and qualifications:        Job Responsibilities:        Database Design and Modeling: Create and maintain database schema designs, including tables, indexes, and relationships, using tools like ER diagrams      SQL Query Development: Write complex SQL queries, stored procedures, and triggers to extract, manipulate, and manage data efficiently      Database Optimization: Identify and resolve performance bottlenecks by optimizing SQL queries, indexing, and database configurations      Data Integration: Develop ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) processes to move data between different systems and databases      Data Security: Implement and maintain database security measures, including user access control, encryption, and data masking as necessary      Backup and Recovery: Establish and manage database backup and recovery procedures to ensure data integrity and availability      Performance Monitoring: Monitor database performance using tools like performance counters and query execution plans, and make necessary adjustments      Data Validation and Testing: Verify data accuracy through validation checks and perform unit testing and integration testing of SQL scripts      Documentation: Maintain comprehensive documentation of database schemas, processes, and code changes      Collaboration: Collaborate with other teams, such as software developers and data analysts, to understand their data needs and provide necessary support      Version Control: Use version control systems to manage database code changes and collaborate effectively with team members      Troubleshooting: Diagnose and resolve database-related issues and provide technical support when needed
column11: Architect, query optimization, SQL database, Database design, Analytical, Schema, Database administration, OLAP, OLTP

Lead team discussions to define technical requirements on new and current products.     Respond-to and troubleshoot highly complex problems quickly, efficiently, and effectively.     Mentor junior engineers.       What You Will Need:       BS degree in Computer Science or a related technical discipline (or equivalent experience). Experience maintaining and extending an existing codebase, adapting to pre-existing patterns and tracing the code s path of execution.     Experience implementing ETL workflows (SSIS or AWS). column2: The Principal Engineer will be a senior technical expert involved in the design and implementation of our cloud data platform. They will work closely with Architects, DevOps, Data Engineers, and Quality Engineers to ensure alignment and improve our ability to deliver.? The Principal Engineer needs to have knowledge of all the different aspects of technical delivery for a cloud data platform as well as the ability to understand and translate business requirements into robust technical solutions.     Strong understanding of GCP environment and offerings   Experience in at least 2 sizeable GCP projects as a Senior Engineer or Architect   Strong in Data Architecture and Data Management (Catalog, Modelling, ETL, Data Warehousing trends) ??Data Warehouses, Data Lake, RDBMS, Data Governance, Data Quality, Data Lineage   Strong Hands-on experience in native services like BigQuery, DataFlow, Cloud Storage, Cloud Functions, Cloud Composer, APIs (with multiple technologies like Python, .net etc.)   Aware of other services and frameworks and how they can be used to solve problems   Understand and guide the current architecture and work directly with Scrum teams to implement and improve the Data Platform.   Candidates should be flexible / willing to work across all phases of delivery.? Solution design, POC, development and testing.? Able to support multiple Scrum teams in various locations, both domestic and international.       Day-to-day Responsibilities       You will be responsible for working closely with the development leads, architects, and team members to design and review the end-to-end solution, take on hands-on development of the technically complex components to help the development teams, and help in troubleshooting technical issues.   You will assist Scrum teams with the adoption of new technologies and share your knowledge and mentor team members.   You are responsible for the management and mitigation of technical risks, ensuring that the data platform can be realistically delivered by the underlying technology components in a high-performing way.   Be the go-to person for the Scrum teams in case of any questions/issues and help drive the teams in the right direction.   Own and communicate technical architecture and implementation.   Provide cost optimization strategies for the implementation   Should be able to contribute to developing code along with scrum teams.       Required Skills and Experience       At least 7-10 years overall experience, with minimum 3 years relevant experience in similar roles.   Bachelor?? Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Math or related fields.   Strong data engineering skills and GCP services.   Solid background in cloud-first environments and building cloud-native platforms.   Hands-on, "roll up your sleeves" collaborative style of working.   Experience consuming data from a variety of sources (various APIs, microservices, event streams, etc.).   Experience in Automotive industry is a plus, and curiosity is a requirement.
column11: Computer science, Data management, GCP, RDBMS, Scrum, Data quality, Troubleshooting, Automotive, Python, Data architecture
